verb.description: Gather together and confine (a group of people or things)
examples: the organizers were corralling the crowd into marching formation

verb.description: Put or keep (livestock) in a corral.

noun.description: A pen for livestock, especially cattle or horses, on a farm or ranch.

origin: Late 16th century: from Spanish and Old Portuguese (now curral), perhaps based on Latin currere to run. Compare with kraal.
